cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.SY

Reasoning: The paper deals with experimental design for linear regression tasks, which is a common problem in machine learning and statistics. The use of Bayesian methods and determinantal point processes suggests a focus on probabilistic modeling and sampling techniques, which are often studied in the sub-fields of machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also mentions statistical criteria and optimization algorithms, which are relevant to the sub-fields of statistics (cs.ST) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the application of the proposed methods to control systems (cs.SY) suggests a potential interest in engineering and control theory.
